text:
The 'Forever' checkbox in front of 'Loop Count' in 'Thread Group' doesn't work
properly.

It doesn't set value of property "LoopController.continue_forever" (for
particulat thread group) to 'true' when checked.

Also it the loop count doesn't have any effect on number of times the thread
group executes.

Bug exists in latest nightly also (4th June).

text:

e.g. sample test plan
and jmeter.log file.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
It seems that 'Once Only Controller' under a 'Thread Group' has effect on thread
group's loop count.

I have added a test plan. This plan has one 'Thread Group', one 'Once only
Controller' as its child and one 'HTTP Sampler' as child of the once only
controller.

If the once only controller is replaced with 'Simple Controller' then the test
plan will continue forever.

Please retire this issue if this is expected behaviour. As far as I know a logic
controller only affects its children and not parents.
creator: onkarshinde@gmail.com

text:
The Test Plan only contains a single Sampler under a Once Only Controller.

That runs once for each thread, by design.

The Thread Group then has nothing left to do, so stops.
So in this sense the Once Only controller does affect its parent.

However, if you add a further sampler after the Once Only Controller, the Thread
Group does continue to loop.
creator: sebb@apache.org
